Motion sickness: Some individuals may experience motion sickness when using virtual reality, which can affect their ability to focus and participate effectively in the training program.
Cost: Developing a virtual reality training program can be expensive, which may be a barrier for some organizations with limited budgets.
Accessibility: Not all individuals may have access to the necessary virtual reality equipment or technology, which can limit their ability to participate in the training program.
User experience: The virtual reality training program may not be engaging or enjoyable for participants, which can lead to a lack of motivation and poor retention of information.
Security concerns: Virtual reality training programs may be vulnerable to security breaches or hacking, which can compromise the confidentiality and integrity of the training content.
